meanings.definition: The act of carrying or transporting goods over land between two bodies of water.
meanings.sent1: The portage was challenging as we had to carry our heavy bags over the rocky terrain.
meanings.sent2: The portage between the lakes was a necessary part of our journey.
meanings.sent3: The portage turned into a race as we tried to see who could reach the other side first.
meanings.sent4: The portage felt like a test of our endurance and strength.
meanings.sent5: The portage under the scorching sun made us appreciate the value of teamwork.

meanings.definition: A route or path used for carrying boats or goods over land between two bodies of water.
meanings.sent1: The portage was well-marked with signs guiding us on the path to the river.
meanings.sent2: The portage provided a convenient way to transport our canoes to the other side of the island.
meanings.sent3: We followed the portage through the forest, feeling like explorers on a mission.
meanings.sent4: The portage resembled a lifeline connecting the two bodies of water.
meanings.sent5: The portage was a lifeline for our journey, ensuring we could continue our adventure.
